name: Black-Eyed Peas and Rice
author: Negman
ingredients: ½ cup chopped green bell pepper
2 pinches paprika, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place black-eyed peas into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat; cook and stir ham until browned, about 5 minutes
Add onion, green bell pepper, and garlic; saute until onion is tender, about 10 minutes
Add black-eyed peas, water, bay leaves, paprika, salt, and black pepper; cover pot with a lid and simmer until peas are tender, 40 to 50 minutes
Remove bay leaves from black-eyed peas mixture and stir in rice
Simmer until all the liquid is evaporated, 5 to 10 more minutes
